pr_title: Fix for Issue #10670: Allow JAX-RS Application.getSingletons() to handle CDI proxy classes

timeline.author: andymc12
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,205 @@

+package com.ibm.ws.jaxrs20.cdi12.fat.test;
+
+import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;

timeline.author: andymc12
andymc12

timeline.bodyText: These should be put in the @Before (to start the server) and @After (to stop it) methods - both methods might need to throw Exception.  Once in those methods, it will apply to all tests, so you can remove these lines from each test method.
timeline.author: andymc12

timeline.bodyText: Just a thought, but maybe this method could be put in some utils class so that we only need it in one place - then all of the getSingletons() methods that need to invoke it could just call CDIUtils.getBean(<resourceClass>);. What do you think?
timeline.author: andymc12

timeline.bodyText: Just a thought here... I think it is also possible for CDI to inject the ServletContext (using @Inject ServletContext servletContext2; - maybe we could include this in the test too?  That would ensure that ServletContext injection works regardless of who injects it.
timeline.author: andymc12

timeline.bodyText: It might be good to test ServletContext injection in the resource classes too.
timeline.author: andymc12

+@ApplicationScoped

+

timeline.bodyText: It seems weird to be importing an "internal" package.  Please make sure that the CDI team is ok with us using this class - possibly a better approach would be to put CDI Utils in a different (more public) package.
timeline.author: andymc12
